audio_description: Today I'm going to make Ambur Chicken Biryani. I'm using Seeraga Samba rice. I've taken 500 ml of it. Wash the rice well and soak it for 20 minutes. Next, in a wide pan, add 4 teaspoons of ghee.

audio_description: Next, add 1 tablespoon of oil. Add cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom. Add 3 sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Then add 2 teaspoons of ginger paste and 2 teaspoons of garlic paste.

audio_description: Add a handful of coriander leaves. Mix everything well, cover, and cook on medium flame for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in another pot, boil water with a little salt. Now add the soaked rice.

audio_description: Cook the rice until it's 75% done. Once it's three-fourths cooked, turn off the heat, drain the water, and set the rice aside. The chicken has cooked for 10 minutes. Next, heat a dosa tawa (griddle), place the pot on it, and add the rice on top.

audio_description: Spread the rice gently and evenly. Add 2–3 teaspoons of ghee. Finally, sprinkle some mint and coriander leaves. Cover the pot and seal the edges with dough like this, and cook on medium heat.

audio_description: You’ve just seen how to make delicious Ambur-style chicken biryani. If you follow this method, it’ll definitely turn out amazing. Serve hot right after cooking, maybe with some yogurt raita. Everyone will love it, for sure!
